intro: Bommeria hispida, commonly known as the roughleaf bombax, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in yellow or orange hues. The plant has palmate leaves with hairy surfaces, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in savannas and woodland areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
